intro: Microtis biloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microtis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This species is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. Microtis biloba is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. It is a relatively uncommon plant, making it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
